current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To authorize health insurance issuers to continue to offer for sale current group health insurance
			 coverage in satisfaction of the minimum essential health insurance
			 coverage requirement, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Employee Health Care Protection Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Employee Health Care Protection Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: If you like your group health insurance plan, you can keep it

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
(including any
			 amendment made by such Act or by the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
), a health insurance issuer that has in effect
			 health insurance coverage in the group market on any date during 2013 may
			 continue after such date to offer such coverage for sale during and after
			 2014 in such market outside of an Exchange established under
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Health Care and Education
			 Reconciliation Act of 2010
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Health Care and Education Reconciliation Act of 2010
Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1311
Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1321

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 1501(b) of the Patient
			 Protection and Affordable Care Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1501/ss:b

text.#text:
Health insurance coverage described in subsection (a) shall be treated as a grandfathered health
			 plan for purposes of the amendment made by

header.#text: Treatment as grandfathered health plan in satisfaction of minimum essential coverage

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 S2808 IS: Employee Health Care Protection Act of 2014
